components.description: A white flag, most often shown waving on a post. Traditionally used as a sign of surrender, the meaning of this flag as an emoji is less defined.
components.title: Waving White Flag

components.description:
Zero Width Joiner (ZWJ) is a Unicode character that joins two or more other characters together in sequence to create a new emoji.

Zero Width Joiner, pronounced "zwidge", is not an emoji and has no appearance by itself. This is an invisible character when used alone.

View Emoji ZWJ Sequences that use this character.
components.title: Zero Width Joiner

components.description:
A symbol commonly used to represent those in the transgender community. Used within the draft emoji sequence for the Transgender Flag emoji, and also given emoji presentation on Samsung devices.

Shows as a plain text character on other platforms.
components.title: Male with Stroke and Male and Female Sign

description: A flag with horizontal pale blue and pale pink stripes with a single white stripe in the middle, used as a Transgender or Transgender Pride flag and commonly seen at Pride events.
title: Transgender Flag
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the transgender flag emoji unfurls with crisp, clean lines, its distinct pattern of pale blue, pink, and white stripes rendered with a subtle sheen that speaks to Apple's polished design language.  Each stripe is precisely defined, with soft, rounded edges contributing to its friendly yet respectful presentation.  This important symbol, embodying gender identity and pride, is used to show support, solidarity, and recognition within the LGBTQ+ community.
